name: Strategic Brand Management Mini-MasterClass ONLINE
html_description:
Who it’s for: This session is aimed at those responsible for brand management at a mid to senior level, this could be on a brand or marketing team or as a business owner.

Overview: The team from The Brand Strategy will guide you through some essential factors of strategic brand management, you will leave with new understanding and tools that you can use in your business straight away. This will be an interactive session.

Presenters: You will be guided through four areas led by Mark Smith, founder of The Brand Strategy and lecturer of Nottingham Business School, along with other members of the team including Ruth Sneddon, strategic copywriter; Joanna Finchen-Parsons, strategist and independent development editor; and Philippa Mwayi, Digital Content Planner.

Programme:
Supercharge your week, with a raft of new skills and knowledge that you will take straight back to your brand team or business. Our plan is to ensure that half a day invested in your development on Monday morning will reap dividends across the rest of your week and beyond. 

The masterclass consists of four separate sessions that can be booked separately, but work best as one programme together. Each part (session) will last 60 minutes.

PART 1: "Eudæmonic Transformation" - a new approach to brand decision making for long-term sustainable profit
With many businesses collapsing and struggling to stay afloat in the current crisis, the time has never been more poignant to think about sustainable decision making in business. Yet with so much of the interface with the customer based around short-term return  on investment deliverables, it is easy to be distracted by vanity measures rather than long-term sustainable profit delivery. 

Attendees will have a tool to begin to think strategically about business decisions and recognise the warning flags to identify with quick-win opportunities. 

PART 2: "Choose your words carefully” - crafting a credible purpose statement
Understanding and clearly articulating your business purpose can have deep implications for why, how and what you deliver - and whether your customers and colleagues believe in you. In this workshop, discover how to use the power of words to capture the spirit of your business in a clear, credible and inspiring way.

Attendees will learn how to craft a motivating purpose statement and have a first attempt at writing it.

PART 3: “Knowing Your Customer” - identifying the Optimum Segment
Too often businesses are marketing to the wrong people, meaning advertising pounds are wasted and customers are left dissatisfied unnecessarily. This session will cover the fundamentals of segmentation, targeting and positioning.

Attendees will leave with tools they can immediately apply to their own businesses to improve efficiencies.

PART 4:  “Identifying Customer Moments to Unlock Value” - improve the customer experience with a commercial lens
Every element of the customer experience holds opportunity to add or lose value - both for the business and for the customer’s experience and perception of the brand. This session will cover identification of these ‘moments’ and the importance of attributing both customer value and business value to each moment, then prioritising each.

Attendees will leave with the understanding of the detail of customer experience brought to life with case studies such as how a simple 50p door wedge could create £2m additional revenue for their business!

Who are The Brand Strategy: Midlands based agency The Brand Strategy exist to create long-term sustainable brand turnaround that adds value both to your business and to consumers' lives. They are driven by ensuring brands not only survive, but thrive by creating Eudæmonic Transformation for brands to develop brand and customer experience.

name: Microsoft Office 365. Do you like getting your money's worth?
html_description:
Question: Do you use Office 365 for Business and If so, which applications are you using? If your answer is limited to Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook then this is an event you DO NOT want to miss. Learn how to unlock the modern ways of working in O365, no matter where you are or what device you are on. Learn how to easily access, share edit files in real time with co-author capability. Share your opinion and personality in one to one messages by sending gifs and emojis or to a wider audience with group chat and instantly go from group chat to a video conference with just the touch of a button. Unleash the power of your Team to share and manage content in a collaborative SharePoint workspace.

Become smarter and more productive using Office 365 and all at no extra cost.  

The event is aimed at any individual or organisation of any size, where Office 365 for Business is their primary software application.

Across any sector where the workers require collaboration tools to communicate with colleagues across the world and share information in real time.

Where an organisation has rolled out Office 365 without a formal training plan and therefore the workforce is unaware of the new features it contains.

What will attendees gain? 

The time saving and cost benefits are significant in several areas across the business:

1. Workers can manage and organise their own documents more efficiently between co-workers and reduce duplication.

2. Reduce the need and cost of third party cloud file storage to share documents within the organisation.

3. Reduce the need and cost of third party online meeting software across the organisation.

4. Reduce travel time and enviromental imptact to meetings using simple chat, group chat and video conferencing capabilities of O365.

5. Improve the capability and ease to work from home and outside the office using cloud file storage

6. Unify the way that the organisation collaborates and shares information.

Agenda: 

Presentation and live demonstrations by Timothy Price

10:00-10:15 Introductions and agenda

10:15-10:45 Managing and sharing personal documents in OneDrive for Business

10:45-11:15 Team collaboration, document management and sharing in a SharePoint workspace

name: The true cost of poor management
html_description:
Gallup (2016) found that one of the most important decisions companies make is who they hire as managers. But is management something we value and prioritise as a business? We put so much effort into our systems and processes. We innovate to try to be the very best at what we do. We invest in training to mitigate the cost of underperforming employees. But what about the manager? Do we appreciate just how critical they are to our business? Do we know how much damage a poor manager can do?  This workshop is designed to help you understand the true cost of poor management within you organisation. It also provides practical advice on what you can do to address this.  

The event is aimed at SMEs, HR Mangers, newly appointed managers and team leaders. 

Attendees will be able to learn about why it is important to take care of their staff, ensure that managers are trained, and of the importance of creating a healthy working environment. This will include managing mental health in the workplace and its effects on team dynamics, how to create a productive and healthy working environment and how managers can gain the necessary skills. 

This 3 hour session includes business simulations and case studies to consider the following:

  • Where do managers come from?
  • What makes a good manager?
  • How does a poor manager impact on the business?
  • How to create a good manager?
  • How to fix a bad manager?

Speaker: Mike Ryan, Tutor, Gecko Programmes

name: Get More Clients NOW! ONLINE
html_description:
If you're looking for more high-quality leads, this online workshop is for you! What we’ve learned about most business owners is this: You are BRILLIANT at what you do - ✳️ You've done the work ✳️ You've got the experience ✳️ You love what you do ✳️ And you really care about getting the right results for your clients. You’ve had a handful of great referrals that turned into ideal clients but can’t seem to get any real traction going from your network. And you're fed-up with buying data and trying all this online marketing stuff, which never quite turns up the goods either.

If any of this sounds familiar to you, we want to give you something different.

In our ‘Get More Clients NOW’ workshop, we will share with you our Top Tips for getting more business by referral, that you can go away and IMPLEMENT straight away.

You see, we've been through the same pain trying to attract the right clients, just like you.

So we know EXACTLY how you feel.....

And it's about time that we had a change and start talking about the real facts and not a load of spammy mumbo-jumbo.

Instead, we’ll show you the techniques you need to nurture your existing network to provide all the referrals you need to only work with your ideal clients...

Our technique (if you can call it that!) is simple.

It's the old-fashioned relationship building that long-lasting (and high earning) salespeople have always used...

...just implemented with your existing relationships in a very specific way to attract your ideal clients.

So, if you want more of the right clients, at the right time, at the right price, then you need to be at this workshop!

This workshop is for you if you have to generate sales.

You may be the business owner or the person responsible for bringing in the business.

Either way - you will be frustrated with your networking and understand that referrals are the most cost effective way to grow your business.

You want to know how you can implement a structure and a strategy around getting consistent and proactive referrals for your business.  

What you will discover at this workshop:-

You will leave this workshop with actionable information that you can implement in to your business, immediately.

Dawn Owen

Jackie Casey

name: Mental Fitness for Local Business People in a Post-Covid World ONLINE
html_description:
Understand the root causes for your fear/stress/anxiety and learn how to command your mind to remain clear-headed and focus. I'm a Stourbridge-based personal development coaching practice. For more info, visit lunarcoaching.com

In 2020 very few of us in business here in the Black Country have avoided being negatively affected in some way by the coronavirus pandemic. For many, there has been a lot of extra stress added upon the everyday challenges of running our business.

So, looking to the future, in this workshop I'm going to explain what mental fitness is and how it can help you come into a post-COVID world better and more able to meet challenges both in business and life with a positive mindset.

Just like your body needs certain activities to stay fit and capable, your mind requires intentional training and guidance to stay strong and orientated. A key aspect to cultivate better mental fitness as a local business person is to understand how you self-sabotage: the behavioural patterns that are causing you fear/stress/anxiety and stopping you from performing better or achieving more. 

In this workshop, I’ll be talking about 3 common self-sabotaging personas, how they are affecting your business operations, practical measures you can take to avoid the negative effects as well as commanding your mind to remain clear-headed and focused.

This workshop includes:
• An overview of mental fitness: what is it and how it’s relevant to all of us;
• Identifying 3 common “Saboteurs” (self-sabotaging behavior pattern): the Judge, the Avoider (procrastinator) and the Hyper-Vigilant (constant worrier).
• Introducing practical measures to self-command.  

The event is suitable for business owners, team leaders, startup solopreneur/entrepreneur, or anyone that is interested in gaining better adaptability and positive mindset for their career or business growth. 

Attendees will gain the following information:

1. An understanding of what Mental Fitness is.
2. A new sense of self-awareness: knowing which parts of them that are not helping themselves to succeed, to be fulfilled and happy. 
3. An insight into building self-command brain muscles: small steps to take in any business circumstance/ situation to train their mind to stop chattering and stay focus.

Agenda: 

10:00 – 10:15am: Opening, Zoom check-in, simple reminders on Zoom etiquette, a brief introduction of myself and then a breathing exercise to get all attendees grounded and focus.  

10:15 – 10:30am: An overview of Mental Fitness: what is it, how is it measured, how it is relevant to us and our business performance?  

10:30 – 11:00am: There are 10 universal self-sabotaging behavior patterns, aka the Saboteurs. They are the root causes of our negative emotions, i.e. stress, anxiety, self-doubt, frustration, shame, guilt and so on. To improve our Mental Fitness, we must first understand which of these patterns are “running our shows”.  

For this workshop, I’ll be talking about 3 common Saboteurs that we can all resonate with: in the Judge (harsh critic), the Avoider(procrastinator) and the Hyper-Vigilant (constant worrier). Specifically, I’ll identify their characteristics, feelings, thoughts and impacts.  

Attendees will be given a brief moment to reflect on how they’re being affected by these 3 saboteurs.  

11:00 -11:15am: I’ll introduce 3 practical exercises to build our self-command brain muscles. These exercises can be done with our eyes open, in any business situations and will immediately activate the brain areas that calms ourselves down. We’ll be refocused and able to make better decisions.     

11:15 – 11:30 Special offer and opportunity for BCBS attendees. Q&A. Closing.

name: The Digital Revolution ONLINE
html_description:
Hear about CityFibre’s ambitious plans to make the Midlands one of the best digitally connected regions in the UK.  Full fibre is currently available to less than 15 per cent of premises across the UK.  It is revered as the best in connectivity for its speed, near unlimited bandwidth and reliability.  By using fibre optic cables for every stage of the connection from the customer’s home or business to the internet, users will be offered a significantly superior and more reliable broadband service, capable of Gigabit speeds (1,000 Mbps).

But it is not just individuals and business who will benefit, the installation of the network will give a significant boost to the local economy, as well as providing job opportunities for local people.  

The event is suitable to businesses from all sectors and all sizes. The technology is already being rolled out across many public sector networks, but SMEs and micro business can also benefit.  

Attendees will learn about the different types of infrastructure currently available. They will hear about the benefits of full fibre, which can give them a competitive edge.

Attendees will hear of CityFibre's roll out plans for the technology and which towns and cities are set to benefit from it.  

Speaker: 

Bashir Ahmed MBA - CityFibre's City Manager for Wolverhampton

name: Repowering the Black Country – Economic Opportunities from Accelerated Decarbonisation ONLINE
html_description:
The Black Country has been identified by the government as one of seven strategic industrial
clusters in the UK eligible to receive funding to accelerate the transition to net zero while creating
local jobs and economic opportunities.

This event will summarise the provisional plans to secure and deploy this funding, inviting
feedback and input from the Black Country business community, particularly manufacturers and
energy-intense businesses.

The Black Country Industrial Cluster is responsible for carbon emissions of 1.4 M t CO 2 a year.
The initial study for Repowering the Black Country has identified that this figure will rise to
2.3MtCO 2 by 2030 if we do nothing, but that a focused regional effort could reduce emissions to
net zero while creating an additional 20,000 jobs and adding almost £5bn to Black Country GVA.
The key elements of the plan are likely to include a new approach to energy infrastructure
development, focused on zero-carbon industrial parks; and much wider access to energy
efficiency programmes designed specifically to meet the needs of Black Country businesses. We
are also exploring tailored financial mechanisms and more collaborative working relationships
with energy network providers as well as a proactive approach to securing inward investment in
the region.

The target audience is owners and senior managers of manufacturing and other energy intense
businesses (e.g. hotels, leisure centres) across the Black Country. It is also relevant to landlords
and owners of industrial estates and business parks.

Agenda: 

08:30 - 08:40 Welcome & Introduction - Hosts / Matthew Rhodes

08:40 - 09:00 Repowering the Black Country - Roadmap Project Overview - Matthew Rhodes, BCLEP

09:00 - 09:20 What a zero carbon generation hub might look like - Mark Johnson, Kew Technologies

This event is aimed at people who would like to find out more about the Disability Confident scheme or becoming more inclusive but may not be so sure on how to take the first steps. We are targeting small to medium sized employers. This event is suitable for all sectors and is aimed at Directors, owners, line managers, HR and recruitment staff. There will be no judgement at this event and we are happy to support others on their Disability Confident journey.  

Attendees will gain a knowledge of Disability Confident & the Access to Work schemes and what it means, the opportunity to ask questions and hear examples of other organisation's experiences. There will also be ongoing support on offer for any organisation that wants to join the scheme.

html_description:
This event will focus on how firms across the Black Country can ensure that their premises are safe for members of staff, customers and visitors. With a focus on how Covid 19 has changed business practices, we will be inviting Regulatory Service teams from across the four Black Country Local Authorities to discuss how to Covid-proof a workplace with Black Country businesses. We will also be inviting the Health and Safety Executive as a guest speaker, as well as having business support teams from the various local authorities to answer any questions that businesses may have.  

The world has changed, potentially irrevocably, over the last five months. What was considered normal business practice is now seen as unsafe and potentially life threatening to 'at risk' members of staff.

It is crucial that all business owners, of all sizes and from all sectors, fully understand the role they play in ensuring the safety of their staff.

That's why we think it is crucial, that as united Black Country, we ensure the safety of employees in the region.

We will be calling on the Regulatory Services teams from all Black Country local authorities, as well as the Business Support teams and Public Health, to ensure that MDs, FDs and HR Departments understand what must be done, for their firm to operate in a 'post-lockdown' landscape.  

We want to ensure that attendees can ask the necessary questions and seek the advice they need on making their premises safe.

We will have experts in the room that can point to further support, answer the necessary questions and support businesses to make the necessary changes.

Agenda: 

An hour long session:

- Welcome & Introductions

- Short Contextual Introduction

- Presentation from Regulatory Services

- Presentation from Health & Safety Executive

- Questions from Delegates- AOB / Finish

name: The Reduced Growth Planning Show - 60 minutes to a great Growth Plan - Creative Industries - ONLINE
html_description:
Are you looking to grow your business, increase sales, improve market place penetration, introduce a new product or service or simply improve your bottom line then this fast paced, fun, and interactive introduction to growth planning will be perfect for you. Are you a Wolverhampton business in the creative and digital services sector, forward thinking, actively looking for growth or on the cusp of investing in your growing business.

The event is aimed at owners and Directors of SMEs in the creative and digital sector.  SMEs in this sector are eligible for a free growth Planning workshop programme and for grant support to implement their Growth Plans.

name: Are your ideas and brands protected? Demystifying Patents and Trade Marks ONLINE
html_description:
Possessing IP rights (patents, trade marks, copyright) is a source of competitive advantage and a reward for creativity. Protection of those rights is critical for your business and can mean the difference between success and failure. Your rights may be affected post Brexit. Forresters will provide clear guidance on these topics, using examples of client success stories.

The event is aimed at business owners, manufacturers, marketing directors and managers, technical directors and managers, product designers, branding consultants, solicitors, law firms, accountants, educational sectors, all levels from all types of business. We will help attendees identify the many aspects of their business that can be protected (for example, their name and logo, designs, inventions, trade marks, creative works) to appreciate the value of those assets and to protect themselves from their competitors.  

Attendees will learn about the different types of intellectual property (IP), identify what IP they have themselves (ALL businesses will have some form of IP) and, will appreciate the importance of protecting these valuable assets, particularly in a post-Brexit world  With clear and jargon-free advice, Forresters will explain the steps they need to take to get protection in place. 

Agenda: 

Presentation and Q&A session

Speaker: 

Emma Johnson, Partner

Emma Johnson is a Partner at Forresters and has been with the firm for over 15 years. Emma is a UK and European patent and trade mark attorney and her work is focused on mechanical and electrical inventions, but covers a broad spectrum of technologies. Emma is able to offer an ‘all round’ service to clients. Emma lives near Wolverhampton and is a regular supporter of Black Country Events, for example the BCCoC Expo and Wolverhampton Business Forum networking events.

html_description:
As we slowly navigate our way through the COVID-19 pandemic, our world and our working lives have changed substantially.  A move towards a ‘new normal’ comes with additional responsibilities and pressures for leaders.  So, how can you keep performing at your peak and avoid burnout during tough times?  The event is aimed at business leaders who want to find a better way to cope with the pressures of managing a team of people. 

What will attendees gain?  

• Unlock your capabilities while minimising or eliminating stress

• Get on top of overwhelm and anxiety

• Unleash new levels of energy that you never thought possible

• Release your inner fears and dissolve limiting beliefs

• Discover and understand your master mind and the extraordinary powers it holds

• Learn the daily habits to help you create your dream life

11 - 11.10am - Q&A

name: Creating a mentally healthy workplace
html_description:
Our relaxed lunchtime event will provide local employers with the understanding and actions they need to proactively create a mentally healthy workplace using positive and measurable business benefits.

Sandra Vaughan, Chief Executive of Dudley Mind, will talk through workplace mental health. Mental health problems affect every employer, regardless of size or sector.

This event will provide delegates with an understanding of how they can create and use a framework to create a mentally healthy workplace. Mental health problems are the leading cause of sickness absence in the UK and affect every organisation regardless of size or sector, costing UK businesses almost £35 billion per year.

Attendees will gain a clear understanding of mental health in the workplace allowing them to promote and enable better mental health within their own organisation.Agenda: 

Lunchtime event running from 12 noon to 2:30 pm. There will be light refreshments.

Speaker: Sandra Vaughan, Chief Executive, Dudley Mind.

name: Dealing with terminal illness in the workplace ONLINE
html_description:
For someone receiving a terminal diagnosis, it can feel like their life has flipped upside down. This time can also be difficult for the people surrounding them including their employers. This dealing with terminal illness in the workplace seminar will look to equip employers with the skills to support their staff post diagnosis. Topics explored will include; how to have difficult conversations, how to help them stay in employment longer and advice on additional services available in the area.  

The event is aimed at SME business owners, HR Managers, Team leaders and all sectors.  

Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of terminal illnesses. An understanding of what the employer could and should offer an employee living with a terminal diagnosis or caring for someone with a terminal illness. Better understanding of local services available.  

Agenda: The event will be split into 2 parts. Section one (1:15pm-2:00pm) will be a presentation and discussion with our panelists discussing some key themes surrounding supporting someone diagnosed with a life limiting condition and answering questions from the audience. After a short break we will then run a short Dementia friends session (2:15pm-3:00pm).

Speakers: 

Care staff from Compton Care will discuss:

- The practical side of receiving terminal diagnosis - what employers need to be aware of.

- The emotional support employers can offer, offer advice on how to broach difficult conversations and offer advice on local services available.

name: Intellectual Property Protection for Innovations ONLINE
html_description:
Come and join us for a virtual IP and product development workshop run by the Science in Industry Research Centre (SIRC).  The virtual session will cover Intellectual Property Protection for Innovations , Product Development and University Collaborations. nnThe Science in Industry Research Centre (SIRC) is an ERDF project based at the Wolverhampton Science Park and run by the University of Wolverhampton. SIRC will support businesses to develop new science based products and processes. The centre will support SMEs in the Black Country, Greater Birmingham and Solihull, The Marches as well as Stoke on Trent & Staffordshire. Eligible applicants benefit from initial fully-funded support to refine their product concept and its development requirements (typically a minimum of 12 hours support from SIRC specialist staff).

This work shop is free to attend and is part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF).

Before the workshop you will be sent a link to join the session.  

Who is the event aimed at:

Businesses interested in product development or IP.   Attendees will find out more about how SIRC can support product or process development and what to consider when it comes to IP.  

What will attendees gain?

Develop knowledge around IP and your rights. Learn about how SIRC can support you to develop a new product or process.

name: Your Skills, Your Future ONLINE
html_description:
We all know that these are challenging times for business and if we are to emerge from the impact of COVID-19, protect jobs and create long term stability for the West Midlands economy, we will have to take the long view whilst managing the immediate effects on day-to-day business.

This event will outline all of the support that Dudley College of Technology can bring to bear to support the skills base of your business.

We will be talking about:

Fully funded Apprenticeship Training for non-levy employers. We will share how we can cover the cost of training due to our partnerships with the West Midlands Combined Authority, Dudley Council and others.


Incentives for newly hired Apprentices. We will explain how you can access up to £3,000 for every new apprentice that you hire before January 31st 2021.


Traineeships. This new programme means you can receive up to £1,000 each for up to 10 trainees you welcome into your business.


Kickstart. We will explain how your business can receive 100% of the National Minimum Wage for 6 months for every unemployed person that you hire.


Free Recruitment Service. Be it apprentice or trainee, we will explain how we can enable you to access the talent of the future.


Academies. The launch of the Dudley Engineering and Manufacturing Academy has been a huge success. A new way to find the engineers of the future, we have repeated this innovative model of recruitment out to new sectors in the launch of our Advanced Construction and Hairdressing Academies. Find out how you can recruit tried and tested young Apprentices into your business.


T' Levels. This brand new qualification went 'live' in September 2020 and will provide a high quality technical option alongside an academic route for students aged 16 to 19. Find out how your business can be part of the future success of T Levels.


Sector Based Work Academies. If you need to recruit a skilled workforce with the right skills to sustain and grow your business, we will explain how we can work with you to create a programme bespoke to the needs of your organisation.


English as a 2nd Language. We can improve your employee’s English speaking, reading and writing skills by offering specialised English language lessons in your workplace. Find out how.


The Black Country & Marches Institute of Technology is taking shape next door to the Black Country Living Museum. This major new £32.5m development will provide high-quality training opportunities with clear pathways to skilled jobs in the following sectors: Advanced manufacturing, Modern construction methodologies, Medical engineering and Digital Technologies. Come and learn about the future of Higher Level Technical education in the Black Country. 

The event is aimed at Business Owners and Directors, L&D and HR Professionals. 

Attendees will leave with a clear understanding of the new routes their business will be able to access to reach the skilled workforce of the future. Employers will also learn how they can access the skills of Dudley College of Technology students for free, to support projects, add capacity or trial what it might be like to employ an apprentice. 

Agenda:
08.00am - 09.00am:

Presentations and Q&A

Speakers: 

Georgina Barnard - Managing Director of Black Country & Marches Institute of Technology

Nick Thompson – Head of Employer Engagement, Dudley College of Technology

name: Midland Metropolitan University Hospital Special with Balfour Beatty: ONLINE
html_description:
This virtual ‘meet the buyer’ event on Thursday 8 October is your chance to meet tier-one contractors for Balfour Beatty Plc, principal contractor for the Midland Metropolitan University Hospital (MMUH).

Hosted by Sandwell Council and Sandwell Business Ambassadors (www.sandwellbusinessambassadors.co.uk), this interactive event will give you insight and guidance on winning work on the £267m project – as well as Balfour Beatty’s other regional projects, including the redevelopment of the Black Country Living Museum.

Taking place from 9:30am to 11.00am, it is suitable for business owners, business development professionals, directors who would like their businesses to be in with a chance of supplying the landmark MMUH development. It will show you the types of subcontract works packages, components and ancillary services needed by Balfour Beatty’s tier-one suppliers. The event is also a great networking opportunity, allowing you to connect with buyers directly involved in the project and find out what they look for in suppliers.

Attendees will hear from Bob Hallam-Allsop, Balfour Beatty’s MMUH Project Director and Corin Godsmark, Account Director. Bob and Corin will give a background to Balfour Beatty, talk about the story of MMUH, and share images of internal designs – including a virtual tour of the site. You will also hear about MMUH procurement timelines and the likely lower-tier contracts coming up for grabs.

Corin will talk more generally about supplying to Balfour Beatty on other Midlands- based contracts, such as the Black Country Living Museum, HS2 in the region, new schools and building improvement programme and the M6 Junction 10 development. He will give advice on working for Balfour Beatty post-COVID, offering an overview of supplier approvals, the provision of safe and productive workplaces, accreditations and COVID-19 audits needed by suppliers working on major infrastructure projects.

This is a valuable opportunity to hear about supply chain assessments and the different levels of approvals needed for high-risk trades.

Agenda

09:30am Welcome and introduction to Sandwell Business Ambassadors from Alan Taylor, chair of Sandwell Business Ambassadors
10.10am Bob Hallam-Allsop and Corin Godsmark on:

  • The story of MMUH
  • Key facts and figures
  • Virtual tour
  • Key dates & project milestones
  • Sandwell & West Birmingham NHS Trust – employment opportunities
  • Supply chain partners – key trades (Flynn Interiors)
  • Social Value
  • Project opportunities with Sandwell
  • Project opportunities with Balfour Beatty
  • Becoming a Balfour Beatty supplier

10.50am Event summary and close.

Speakers: 

Alan Taylor – Sandwell Business Ambassadors

Corin Godsmark – Account Director – Balfour Beatty Construction (Midlands)

Bob Hallam-Allsop - MMUH Project Director - Balfour Beatty Construction (Midlands)

name: Emissions Reduction and Fuel Quality Open Day & Demonstration ONLINE
html_description:
It's a fully interactive session which provides an ideal forum for you to quiz IPU on everything involving emissions and fuel contamination, along with sharing ideas and opinions with a knowledgeable audience. We will cover legislation, emissions technology, fuel contamination and solutions, open dialogue and a showcase of our exhaust aftertreatment system and fuel products in action.  

Who is the event aimed at? Anyone with a diesel genset!

You may have one on site for backup power (the fuel you have stored is likely degrading). If you run it for over 50 hours a year, it needs to be compliant with new legislation. Every single diesel genset (regardless of it's use or application or age), also needs a permit. This will also be extremely useful for Facilities Management Companies, Generator Service Companies, or anyone else who has a keen interest in the changing world of emissions and the growing problem of fuel contamination.  

Guests will be clued up on the latest fuel issues and how they can be tackled. They will also have an introduction into the minefield of emissions legislation and depending on the audience, we can go into as much detail as necessary! Attendees will also learn the basic technology used to tackle emissions and when/where they should be used.  

Timings:

10am – 11:15am – Presentation

11:15am – 12pm – Q&A

Speakers: 

David Caddick - IPU Sales & Technical Director

Mike Benzies  - IPU Business Development Director (Fuel Expert)

Ian Brewin - IPU Area Sales Manager

name: Photonic Technologies for Food & Drink and Agriculture Industries ONLINE
html_description:
This interactive webinar is hosted by Aston University as part of the Enabling Technologies & Innovation Competences Challenge Project. ETICC project is part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) and offers FREE support and expertise in photonics, materials and computer science/AI to 50 small and medium businesses from Black Country and Greater Birmingham & Solihull areas; this support is available until the end of July 2021.

This webinar was developed for the companies in Food & Drink industry, the UK's largest manufacturing sector. Photonics technologies have wide application in food processing and help improve hygiene and food security, reduce food waste and enhance the information received by the consumer. The workshop will cover methods for:

- Real time monitoring of food quality critical parameters

- Detection of food chemical composition

- Detection of pathogen bacteria, residues, and other contaminants in food matrices

- Real time measurement of fruit/produce maturity.

Agenda:

10:15 - Mid-IR Spectroscopy for Detection of Food Chemical Composition

10:35 - Aston Institute of Materials Research: Testing Capabilities

10:45 - Photonics Technology for Agriculture sector

11:00 - Application of Photonic Sensors in Food Industry

11:15 - Demo: Fourier-Transform Infrared Spectrometer

11:30 - Demo: Hyperspectral Imaging System

11:45 - Q&A

12:00 - End

Speakers: Dr Kaiming Zhou, Dr Vlad Dvoyrin, Dr Alex Rozhin, Dr Payal Baheti, industry guests - Milling Trade Ltd

name: WBBN Annual Business Conference 2020 ONLINE
html_description:
This event will engage with high level entrepreneurs and leaders of organisations to appear as guest speakers on various business topics. Speakers will be from the DIT, Wolverhampton University, a local business, the Fire Service, the City Council and a Local Bank.  Local politicians will also be involved to give some overview on topical issues concerning business of the minorities in our area.  We also invite Black Country businesses to display their goods and Services at the event, however please contact WBBN for details. 

This event is aimed at Black Country businesses to showcase themselves in our area, along with learning from local expert speakers. Attendance will open up various opportunities for trade and future engagements.  

What will attendees gain from attending this event?

Grow your business and learn from the expert speakers who will be attending the event: DIT, Wolverhampton University, a local business, the Fire Service, the City Council, a local bank.

Agenda:

6.00 - 6.10pm - Introduction of speakers by Janet Smith - JS Associates 

6.10 - 6.15pm - Welcome remark by WBBN Executive Director, Sam Duru 

6.15 - 6.35pm - Ms Samantha Samuels – Station Commander Fallings Park Fire Station, West Midlands Fire Service (WMFS)   

6.35 - 6.55pm - Mr Gerald La Touche JP, MA, MIEX– International Trade Adviser (DIT) West Midlands 

6.55 - 7.15pm - Dr Paschal Anosike Associate Professor for Entrepreneurship & Innovation; Director Centre for African Entrepreneurship & Leadership (CEAL), University of Wolverhampton

7.15 - 7.25pm - Comfort break 

7.25 - 7.45pm - Mr Demo Andu LLB (Hon.) LLM. MBA. Local Entrepreneur 

7.45 - 8.05pm - Mr Lakhbir Singh–Local Director Metro Bank, Wolverhampton   

8.05 - 8.25pm - City of Wolverhampton Representation (to be confirmed)

8.25 - 8.50pm - Panel Discussion 

8.50 - 9.00pm - Vote of thanks by Mr Michael Bolorunduro, WBBN Director.

name: Protecting your business against cyber threats ONLINE
html_description:
This workshop unmasks the cyber challenges faced by businesses by sharing trends in cyber security threats and the current state-of-the-art approaches to boost businesses readiness.  Last year, 12.5 million UK records were compromised in a single cyberattack, and it took a major online service provider in the USA up to 3 years to realise that 3 Billion customers account details were accessed by attackers. Modern business operations connected to the cyberspace are facing challenges including but not limited to Ransomware, Cryptojacking, Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS), Malware, and Phishing.

Cyber security is something that every business needs to be aware of and experts from the Wolverhampton Cyber Research Institute will unmask some of the cyber challenges faced by businesses and individuals. This workshop will discuss trending cyber security threats and the current state-of-the-art approaches to boost businesses readiness.  

Speaker: Professor Prashant Pillai, University of Wolverhampton

name: Planning for Success within a Family Business ONLINE
html_description:
Family businesses should be applauded as they make up around 85% of UK Businesses, employ 13.4 million people and typically demonstrate strong values and a commitment to local communities. However, anyone in a Family Business knows that they face unique performance and governance challenges and many of the problems that exist in corporate business environments can be exaggerated.  Properly documenting and structuring the family business requires consensus on the key issues and we will hear from three experts who are experienced in supporting families, helping the business grow. We will also explore solutions where consensus proves difficult, or when disputes are well entrenched.  

Whilst open to everyone, this event will add benefit to those in Family Businesses as well as all those who advise them in some capacity.  

Attendees will get a better understanding of:

• The importance of planning, good housekeeping and governance

• Issues relevant to the ownership and management of the company, now and in the future

• Getting the constitutional documents right

• Joining up with personal affairs

• Mediation and how successful it is in resolving conflict

Attendees will also hear from George Bryan who has first-hand experience of growing up in a Family Business and is a certified Family Business Consultant, supporting other families in business.

Speakers: 

Paul Hunt, Partner at Higgs & Sons and Head of Business Succession Planning

George Bryan, Director at Drayton Manor Park and a certified Family Business Consultant

Tim Jones, Partner at Higgs & Sons and recognised by Chambers and Partners as one of the Top 35 Mediators in the UK with a wealth of experience in resolving family business disputes

name: The Reduced Growth Planning Show - 60 minutes to a great Growth Plan - Advanced Manufacturing ONLINE
html_description:
Are you looking to grow your business, increase sales, improve market place penetration, introduce a new product or service or simply improve your bottom line then this fast paced, fun, and interactive introduction to growth planning will be perfect for you.  Are you a Wolverhampton business in the manufacturing sector, forward thinking, actively looking for growth or on the cusp of investing in your growing business.

We will showcase the successes of companies who have implemented successful Growth Plans and secured financial support, and who were in the first cohort of the AIM for GOLD Programme.

We will share with you how you could apply for a grant of up to £20,000 to help unlock your businesses growth potential, and where else you could get funding.

You will meet some of the businesses who have already been awarded their funding, learn about the different elements of the programme, and be given the opportunity to register your interest in being part of cohort 3.  

The event is aimed at manufacturing SMEs in Wolverhampton.  

What will attendees gain?

  • An understanding of the value of Growth Planning
  • What makes a great Growth Plan - increase sales, secure new markets, and or develop new products and services
  • Details of the AIM for GOLD Growth and Grant Programme
  • Options to finance growth

Agenda: 

9.00am - Event commences

Growth Planning: the key elements - Glenn Watts

Growth Planning: value to the business - Gabitie and PGO Ltd

Finance options and the AIM for GOLD Growth Planning Programme - Jay Patel

10.00am Close

Speakers: 

Glenn Watts - Growth Specialist

Grant Bond - owner Gabitie

Ian Dixon - MD PGO Ltd

Jay Patel - Finance Specialist

name: The Future of Manufacturing – Make UK in Conversation with Sector Leaders ONLINE
html_description:
What is the future of manufacturing? What is your business doing to recover? How are you improving productivity? What are West Midlands Manufacturers growth plans? These are just some of the questions that we will be exploring at the Make UK hosted virtual West Midlands Regional Advisory Board Black Country Special. We will be joined by over 30 Make UK members and senior manufacturing leaders, which will be chaired by the Chief Executive Officer of James Lister and Sons a Black Country manufacturing business. We will also be specially joined by industry leading speakers from Make UK, The Manufacturing Technology Centre, Warwick Manufacturing Group and Midlands Manufacturing Commission.  

This event is exclusively aimed at Director and Board level manufacturing leaders of all sized businesses of Make UK members and other Black Country Manufacturers. Attendants will have the opportunity to hear from industry leading experts and manufacturing business leaders on the future of manufacturing, overcoming contemporary challenges and their longer term growth plans. Make UK reserves the right approve your attendance, in order to ensure a manufacturing and business leader cohort is present.  

In hearing from Make UK, industry experts and manufacturing business leaders you will learn:

  • An insight into Make UK's work with Government and Regional governing bodies
  • Hear Industry wide insight into contemporary challenges and future growth strategies
  • Learn manufacturing business best practice
  • Create Manufacturing leaders peer-to-peer connections
  • West Midlands Manufacturing plans and capabilities

Agenda: 

- Welcome from Make UK's Midlands & East Regional Director Charlotte Horobin and West Midlands member Chair Pete Davies Chief Executive Officer of James Lister and Sons.

- Hear from a panel of Industry experts from Make UK, The Manufacturing Technology Centre, Warwick Manufacturing Group and Midlands Manufacturing Commission. 

-Roundtable discussion with senior manufacturing leaders in the West Midlands and Black Country.

Hosts: 

Charlotte Horobin, Region Director, Midlands and East of England at Make UK

Chris Corkan, Regional Membership Manager, Midlands and East of England at Make UK

Peter Davies, Chief Executive Officer at James Lister and Sons and Chair of the Make UK West Midlands Regional Advisory Board

Rowan Crozier, Chief Executive Officer at Brandauer and Vice-Chair of the Make UK West Midlands Regional Advisory Board

Guest Speakers:

Stephen Phipson, Make UK, CEO

Stephen Phipson is the Chief Executive of Make UK, the manufacturers’ organisation. Stephen became Chief Executive of Make UK in 2017 having previously held the position of Head of the Defence and Security Organisation within the Department for International Trade delivering support to UK defence and security businesses. Prior to this Stephen held the position of Director for Security Industry Engagement within the Office for Security and Counter Terrorism at the Home Office where he was the Senior Responsible Owner within Government for the UK security industry.

Professor David Bailey, Senior Fellow, UK in a Changing Europe Programme ad Birmingham Business School

Chris White, Director of Industrial Policy and Insight Executive at The Manufacturing Technology Centre

Professor Jan Godsell, Operations and Supply Chain Strategy, at Warwick Manufacturing Group (WMG)

name: Commercial contracts – common pitfalls and how to avoid them ONLINE
html_description:
Contracts are the life blood of your business, but given the vital nature of these documents you need to be sure they are delivering exactly what you require. The event is aimed at owner-managers, senior managers, directors , contracts managers and all those with a responsibility for running a business in any sector. This key seminar facilitated by experts from Higgs & Sons’ Commercial team drills into what makes a good contract, whilst highlighting some of the common pitfalls you need to be aware of before signing on the dotted line.

Speakers: Laura Pearson, Higgs & Sons

name: Improving business through structured Project Management & LEAN Six Sigma
html_description:
Many businesses face ongoing challenges delivering projects successfully, from planning the Scope, to deliver it within Schedule and Costs agreed. A structured project management framework will help plan and deliver projects successfully. Also, applying principles of LEAN and Six Sigma will help businesses deliver their objectives cost efficiently and effectively, with great customer focus. This masterclass with provide businesses with a overview on Key Project Management principles to implement/improve, along with easy to apply LEAN Six Sigma techniques for every day business. 

This event can be attended by delegates from every sector, at every level of the organization, who is keen to get better. 

This masterclass with provide delegates with a overview on Key Project Management principles to implement/improve, along with easy to apply LEAN Six Sigma techniques for every day business.

Delegates will also receive top tips helping them in defining a roadmap for the improvement journey.

Agenda:

10:00 - 10:10am - Presentation: Introduction and typical challenges faced

10:10 - 10:55am - Structured Project Management framework principles

10:55 - 11:05am - Break

11:05 - 11:50am - Presentation: LEAN and Six Sigma

11:50 - 12:00 noon - Q&A and closure

Speaker: 

Ravi Vetsa, Director

Ravi is an experienced and Certified Project Management Practitioner, Six Sigma Coach/Mentor/Trainer.

name: The Time is Now - Invest Dudley ONLINE
html_description:
Find out why ‘The Time is Now’ to Invest in Dudley, from the council's director of regeneration and enterprise.  This event will promote opportunities across the borough of Dudley, and demonstrate the multitude of projects coming to fruition which will improve Dudley and the Black County. This event is aimed at investors and local businesses who want to know more about regeneration projects and investment opportunities across the borough.  Be the first to hear about projects and find out how you can get involved.

Speakers: 

Helen Martin - Director of Regeneration and Enterprise, Dudley Council

Paul Mountford - Head of Planning and Regeneration, Dudley Council

name: Going Paperless: Buzzword or Reality ONLINE
html_description:
We will explore how adaptability and automation will help you go paperless to create efficiencies and new costs savings.

We will unravel the mysteries that will help you to become a paper 'lite' working environment. The world of print is changing and we have pieced all the clues together for you. Let’s solve this together. We want to educate you on how to scale process improvement and gain efficiencies across the enterprise. This event is aimed at innovators, Managing Directors, Finance Directors and Business Leaders within SMEs across the Black Country. Primarily this event will attract businesses that don’t know where to start when it comes to going paperless with their printing. We will explore the standard practices within businesses and by the end of the event attendees will have a clear understanding of what steps to take to reduce their print and improve their sustainability. 

Firstly, every attendee will get a free paper audit from one of our independent consultants. Secondly have you considered a paperless future? This event will help you to become more innovative in your strategies and how to improve relationships with your customers, utilising technology to drive the change. Come and learn how to ensure process control better, help promote faster processing and better business decision making, while reducing the costs across the business. This can be a ‘land and expand’ approach, or ‘big bang’ enterprise wide from day one. Let us help you become paper 'lite' across your organisation- allowing you to concentrate more on the customer and not the paper.

name: Reviving Retail with HugglePets ONLINE
html_description:
Our workshop will be held online for an one hour, where we will share our top hints and tips in building a sustainable business in the retail sector. Our Director Mike will share with you his creative approach to high street regeneration by sharing his story of building the HugglePets brand across the UK. 

This event is aimed at people who either starting a business or are keen to enhance and grow their businesses, either on or offline. Attendees will be able to look behind the scenes of HugglePets rapid growth in the sector and have insight into our innovative top tips and hints on sustainable growth of their business. 

Agenda: 

  • Welcome & Introductions
  • HugglePets - Our Story so far
  • Top Tips and Hints for a Sustainable Retail Model
  • Question and Answers
  • Close

Speakers: 

Mike Dixon, Director of HugglePets

(Signature Business Award Winner & eBay Events Speaker)

name: A New Age of Advertising & Marketing: How to Tell Your Company’s Story ONLINE
html_description:
From cave walls to Facebook walls, humans have been telling stories since before we could even speak. Hear about how the concept of ‘Branded Entertainment’ can transform the way you communicate with your target audience and workshop ideas for your new marketing activities.

This event is for any Business Owner, Advertiser or Marketer looking for novel and innovative ways to communicate their products, services or values in the age of streaming and social media.  If you have a business with a marketing, advertising or CSR budget (monolithic or microscopic) we guarantee you’ll go away with at least ONE creative idea for communicating with an audience that includes your target buyer.

In an age of social media, storytelling is a persuasive way to communicate the essence of your brand or organisation and demonstrate your relevance in the life of your target market. This is where Branded Entertainment can help.

WHAT IS BRANDED ENTERTAINMENT AND HOW CAN YOU AFFORD TO DO IT?

Whether you sell wall brackets, wedding cakes or wellington boots, we’ll help you rethink your approach to advertising and marketing. You might be a charity in need of volunteers or donations, a venue hosting a range of events or a professional services firm, Branded Entertainment offers the opportunity to tell your story in an engaging way which will connect you to your target market.

Infinite Wisdom Studios is a creative storytelling company that was founded in the Black Country over a decade ago. It’s worked with Hollywood Studios and British institutions like the BBC, to big brands such as Oxfam and Jaguar Land Rover, right through to SMEs and local businesses. It’s seeking to encourage the conversation around ‘Branded Entertainment’ and work with SMEs to support new stories that can promote their businesses locally and nationally.

Birmingham Business School and Katharina Stolley have been undertaking research on the development and application of Branded Entertainment. Together they have developed an interactive workshop where businesses can interact with creative producers to identify their story and explore what Branded Entertainment can do for them. It’s time to stop spending all those marketing budgets on adverts! If you want to find out why, come and hear our story.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND?

Since cavemen painted pictures, and early settlers gathered around campfires to tell stories, humans have been captivated by well told stories. In the age of Netflix, YouTube, Alexa, eBooks, Instagram and Twitter there are more ways than ever before to reach audiences through sound, picture and the written word. Whether you’re a self-starter, a medium sized business, a charity or a non-profit organisation with an Advertising & Marketing Team, we invite you to attend this FREE Storytelling Workshop. 

As part of the day we’ll help inspire and suggest NEW ways to tell your story, or find ways to be a part of someone else’s. Whether you’re looking to generate new customer relationships or strengthen your bond with your existing clients, we’ll show you how to be relevant, think about your company’s role in “The Story” and ensure your communications reflect the values and beliefs of your brand. During the event you’ll workshop ideas together with other businesses and creatives.  

AGENDA: 
09:00-09:30: Introduction: What is Branded Entertainment?
09:30-10:00: Finding Your Story: How can you apply its principals?
10:00-10:30: Comfort Break & Virtual Networking
10:30-11:30: Development Lab: Bringing Your Stories to Life
11:30-12:00: Close & Next Steps  

SPEAKERS:
MICHAEL FORD - Producer, Infinite Wisdom Studios

Wolverhampton-born Michael is an experienced drama producer working with national and global broadcasters including ViacomCBS and BBC. In recent years he has specialised in children’s and family content.

LAUREN BURNHAM & EMILY KIRKHAM - Founders, Prickly Peach Films

Prickly Peach is a multi-Royal Television Society award-winning content agency producing branded video productions for SMEs, and music videos for independent artists and labels.

TIM LUFT - Director, Virtual Reality Simulation Systems

Tim is a veteran of the tech sector and creative advisor on the new immersive storytelling programme from Create Central, employing new technologies to entertain and inform audiences.


MORE SPEAKERS TO BE ANNOUNCED (PLEASE WATCH FOR UPDATES)

name: Building teams in an age of uncertainty
html_description:
There is no doubt we are in uncharted waters. There is no rule book for the current business environment. But this was true before the current crisis. Owing to the rapid technological, cultural and economic change we are having to rethink how we build, manage and develop groups of people to meet company goals whilst achieving their personal aspirations. We talk a lot about the performance of individuals, but usually when we measure teams we look at the individual performance of the manager and hold them accountable for the team performance. But are we missing something about how we have designed the team in the first place? And is there something we could do to help managers, individuals and the company itself perform better by looking at the organisations we have created? This highly interactive workshop is designed to help you to operate and grow during times of uncertainty. You will learn the importance of understanding the diverse skills and qualities of your teams that will allow them to be effective in times of uncertainty and change.

The event is aimed at SME, Senior Managers, Departmental Managers and HR Managers. Attendees will be able to learn how to capture and utilise the skills and qualities of their teams in order to operate and thrive during times of uncertainty.

This 3 hour session includes business simulations and case studies to consider the following:

  • What is a team?
  • Building a team to cope.
  • Developing a team to compete.
  • Getting teams to work together to excel.
  • Ending, merging and refining a team purpose to adapt and change effectively.

Speaker: Mike Ryan, Tutor, Gecko Programmes

name: Life after Furlough - the end of a beautiful relationship ONLINE
html_description:
What are the options for employers as the government's furlough scheme comes to an end? Redundancies, restructuring and a new world of work will face many businesses as we emerge from the effects of the Covid19 pandemic.  The event is aimed at all those involved in managing employees and who have needed to access the government's furlough scheme.  Attendees will gain an insight into how the government plans to wind down its furlough scheme and an insight to how the world of work will be affected. 

Learn how to position your business and workforce for a post-Covid world. Find out why Covid-19 has had such a huge impact on the workplace and what you can do about it. Network with HR professionals and other peoples managers.

Agenda

* The HR and legal challenges that lie ahead for employers after the end of the government's furlough scheme. 

*The 5 key HR steps all employers should take as the furlough scheme ends

 * The challenges that lie ahead - reorganisations and redundancy planning

* The new world of work: remote working - is it so great? How do we manage it?

* The need for effective leadership - what does that look like?

Speaker 

Simon Bond Director, Bond Legal Ltd

name: Property Matters ONLINE
html_description:
Whether you are a developer, contractor, investor or landlord, this seminar will cover a range of property related topics that will ensure your business is up to date with all the latest sector developments. The event is aimed at property sector professionals including developers, contractors, investors and commercial landlords. Highlighting the very best practice, this seminar will ensure your ‘house is in order’ when it comes to achieving success in the property arena. Experts from Higgs’ Property Services team will look at a number of key issues pertinent to property professionals:

- Considerations when developing property – what structure works best; issues which may arise and how to manage these; procurement and construction of the development;

- Leasing property – common misconceptions and what you really need to know;

- Funding and property finance – understanding the expectations of funders in respect of the development.

name: Business Model Automation ONLINE
html_description:
Mapping your Business Model in 5 Steps, and using various technologies better. The event is aimed for businesses across all sectors who are looking for digital solutions to the challenges they face in business planning, day-to-day running and long term delivery. This workshop session will take delegates through the essentials of mapping a business model. Then through the use of freely available tools, create a technology roadmap to address and solve your business challenges.

The new SOLVD project team at University of Wolverhampton will be available to advise on support and funding available.

name: Charity Partnerships - Working together, making a difference ONLINE
html_description:
Charity fundraising is an ideal way to integrate team building exercises and staff development into your company. Smart charities recognise that each business is different; that you have busy lives and don't always have the time to think up new ideas.  We want to show you how, by tapping into a charity's ideas, attending their events, using their marketing, a company can really make a difference to their local community and still fulfill their own goals.  

The event is aimed at business leaders who may get enthusiastic about working with a charity. Staff, at any level, who already organise their companies fundraising who are looking at new and exciting ways of getting involved. Anyone interested in making a difference to their local environment.  

Attendees will gain an understanding of the level of support offered by local charities. How charity partnerships can be invaluable to raising the profile of their chosen charity. The social media, and pr benefits of attending charity events. The extent of resources available to support the smooth running of company run charity events. They will see a full calendar of exciting events and campaigns that they can engage with that require minimal planning, and maximum benefits, to the company. There will also be an insight to how charitable funds make a difference to our hospital.

Agenda:

Opening from Chief Executive or senior Director

Talks from 2 medical consultants about the benefits of large donations

Talks from 2 corporate partners (one solicitor and one charitable grant foundation)

Talk from the Fundraising Manager showing how easy it is to get involved

Close

Speakers: 

Senior Director of Trust Staff

2 Medical Consultants

2 Corporate Partners

Karen Phillips, Fundraising Manager

name: An introduction to Scrum and Agile methods ONLINE
html_description:
A brief Introduction to Scrum and Agile - the core concepts of lean and agile working and how these can be applied in any business to transform the world of work.  If you are a team in charge of delivering a product or project; an individual preparing to work with or on an agile team; a project manager entering the Agile environment; or someone who just wants to learn what all the fuss is about with Agile and Scrum; this course is perfect for you!

Sectors: IT industry, NHS, Banking, Insurance, Education. The session will introduce the core concepts of lean and agile working and show how these can be applied in any business to transform the world of work.  

This informative workshop will provide details on:

• Introduction to Scrum, The Agile Manifesto and Principles.

• When do we use Scrum?

• The Scrum Framework.

• How to use Scrum in non-software situations.

There will be opportunity at the end of the workshop for Q&A.

Speaker: 

Karl Royle: Karl is a Certified Scrum Professional and has been working with agile since 2010.

He is an Agile organisational change coach and facilitator. He specialises in using Scrum beyond the domain of software development. 

Karl is an Agile and Scrum practitioner and uses Open Space Technology, Scrum and Kanban methodologies to transform project direction in HE. Karl is Head of Enterprise and Commercial Development at the Faculty of Education, Health and Wellbeing where he works in research, development and consultancy working on national training and impact evaluation projects, product development and innovation. His current interests are around the process of knowledge transfer between universities and SMEs and the development of core competencies for enterprise, entrepreneurship and employability.

name: Access to Finance Masterclass ONLINE
html_description:
The British Business Bank (BBB) will be holding a briefing event to raise awareness of the £250m Midlands Engine Investment Fund (MEIF) and wider BBB programmes (specifically those developed in response to Covid-19) to provide businesses (and intermediaries supporting businesses) looking to apply to the funds with additional support and information.  

The event is aimed at:

  • SMEs in the Midlands looking for alternative finance to support their business.
  • Intermediaries who support the above businesses.

Attendees will gain the opportunity to understand more about the funding options available, highlight the fund managers and delivery partners who are deploying funds and meet some fellow businesses who have beneffited from investment from BBB.

Agenda: 

09.00am - Session begins

09.05am - Welcome and presentation from British Business Bank

09.20am - Debt Panel - ELEM and Maven

  • ELEM presentation – Victoria Copestake, Business Development Manager – 5 minutes
  • Maven presentation – Jonathan Lowe, Investment Director – 5 minutes
  • Q&A Panel – 10 minutes, BBB to lead

09.40am - Equity Panel – Mercia and Foresight

10.00am - BBB to close

Speakers: 

Victoria Copestake, Business Development Manager 

Jonathan Lowe, Investment Director

name: Apprenticeships in Education, Health and Wellbeing: Opening Doors at the University of Opportunity ONLINE
html_description:
Come and find out more about the Higher and Degree Apprenticeships that are currently being offered and in development at the Faculty of Education, Health and Wellbeing at the University of Wolverhampton.  Subject-specific workshops will be held throughout the day and delegates can 'drop-in' for sessions most relevant to their profession or attend for the whole day to access information relating to funding, contracting and workforce development.  

The event is aimed at: 

  • Employers who are already supporting apprentices on Teaching, Nursing Associate, Registered Nurse Degree, and Social Work Apprenticeship programmes at the University of Wolverhampton.  Employers interested in future apprenticeships being offered within the Faculty; Advanced Clinical Practitioner, District Nurse, Public Health Practitioner, Specialist Community and Public Health Nurse, Midwife, Occupational Therapist.
  • Prospective/new employers who wish to explore current and future apprenticeship programmes offered by the Faculty of Education, Health and Wellbeing.
  • NHS organisations, GP practices, Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs), Nursing Homes, Independent Health/Social Care providers, prospective applicants working in healthcare/social care settings, Care Organisations.
  • Potential applicants who are interested in completing an apprenticeship at the University of Wolverhampton within the Faculty of Education, Health and Wellbeing.  

Find out more about the Higher and Degree Apprenticeships that are currently being offered and in development at the Faculty of Education, Health and Wellbeing at the University of Wolverhampton; programme structure, curriculum, content, requirements for employers, requirements for apprentices, recruitment timelines, admission and contracting process. Information about the Apprenticeship Levy, non-Levy employers, gifting the levy, sub-contracting.

Agenda: Full schedule to be confirmed - workshops for each subject area will be available throughout the day. Attendees can 'drop-in' for the workshop most relevant to their profession.

Speaker: Jackie Mitchell, Head of Academic Development - Apprenticeships, Faculty of Education, Health and Wellbeing, University of Wolverhampton

name: How to Get into UK Rail - Session 2 ONLINE
html_description:
How to Supply into the UK Rail Sector.  The event is aimed at manufacturing and engineering SMEs seeking to diversify into the Rail Sector. Suitable for Senior Management, New Product Development professionals and those with responsibility for generating new sales.  Attendees will gain a valuable insight into the structure of the UK Rail Sector, individual consultation by UK Rail specialists and the opportunity to receive 12 hours worth of European funded assistance to help develop your very own Get into Rail Strategy (subject to SME eligibility must be located within Black Country).

Agenda: 

The event will be one hour in duration consisting of:

  • 30 Minute Power Point Presentation on Get into Rail
  • 15 Minute Networking and Discussions
  • 1-2-1 Consultations for SMEs and support to sign upnfor Digi Rail support

Speakers: 

Rachel Eade - Rail Supply Chain Specialist for BCRRE

Alec Gilham - Organisational Development BCRRE

name: Think Sandwell - support to recruit, upskill and grow your business ONLINE
html_description:
Sandwell Council's Employment and Skills team ‘Think Sandwell’ provide a one-stop-shop solution for all your recruitment and upskilling needs.  Offering impartial advice on apprenticeships and signposting to funded training, support through the recruitment process from writing job descriptions, sifting candidates and arranging interviews.  Our experienced advisors work across all sectors and at all levels; from entry level jobs to management roles.

Our goal is to support local residents to move into sustainable employment and to gain the skills and qualifications to do so. We do this by partnering with local employers to recruit on their behalf; ensuring that your vacancies are filled with suitably skilled and experienced candidates drawn from our local talent pool.

For employers who want to diversify their workforce and tap into hidden talent, we can provide disability awareness training at no cost to the employer and advice and guidance on employing people with disabilities including how to implement low cost workplace adjustment solutions.

This event will provide a walkthrough guide to our service and a taster of our Disability Awareness training.  

Who is the event aimed at?

We support businesses of all sizes and from all sectors. Anyone looking to take on new staff, diversify their workforce and upskill existing workers will benefit. 

What will attendees gain?

The event will offer food for thought on ways to grow, upskill and diversify your workforce.

Learn about how apprenticeships can be utilised to upskill existing staff at little or no increased cost to the business; reducing turnover and improving your employees’ engagement.

Our Specialist Employment team will provide information on how they can support you to increase workforce diversity within your business and meet Corporate Social Responsibility commitments by employing people with disabilities.

name: Thrive at Work Workplace Wellbeing Awards Programme ONLINE
html_description:
The FREE Thrive at Work Workplace Wellbeing Awards Programme has been created in recognition of the need to ensure our working population is supported – designed to encourage and reward employers for improving the health and wellbeing offer to their employees. Already over 400 organisations are taking advantage of this free programme to help improve their staff's wellbeing. The event will tell you more about the programme and how you can join. 

This session is suitable for:

  • Organisations interested in launching or developing workplace wellbeing initiatives
  • Health and wellbeing champions
  • Occupational health and HR managers

The Thrive at Work Workplace Wellbeing Awards Programme provides employers a structure, and the tools and resources to improve the health and wellbeing of their employees and ultimately improve productivity and profit.

The new Foundation level consists of an easy 5 step approach, which will give you a comprehensive understanding of the current wellbeing position of the organisation, the mental and physical wellbeing of your workforce and any lasting impacts as a result of the COVID19 pandemic.

It is open to organisations with more than 8 employees across the East and West Midlands. There are no costs in signing up to Thrive at Work. Application is free as is access to the online toolkit resource, accreditation and award.

You will gain a better understanding of:

  • What is the Thrive at Work Wellbeing Awards Programme?
  • How it can support your organisation
  • Getting started with a simple 5 step approach

AGENDA

  • What is Thrive at Work?
  • Background of how Thrive at Work came about?
  • Impact of poor mental health, Impact mental health has on other aspects of our lives and community
  • Thrive at Work process, 3 Accreditation levels as well as the recently launched Foundation Level
  • Themes 
  • Who has signed up to date?
  • Brief summary 
  • FAQ

Sharon Lindop – Accreditation Manager

Andrew Rudge – Accreditation Assessor

name: ‘British Art Show 9: All you need to know about the additional thousands of visitors coming to the Black Country in 21' ONLINE
html_description:
Every 5 years the British Art Show Tours 4 UK Cities nationwide. In 2021 Wolverhampton is one of the chosen host cities for British Art Show 9 and we can expect up to 70k people to visit the region. This is a great opportunity for those in retail, tourism and hospitality to find out how they can make the best of linking in with the organisers and maximising opportunities for their businesses to benefit from this footfall. 

Who is the event aimed at?

Businesses of all sizes stand to benefit from the influx of visitors to the City. Hospitality, retailers, cafe, pub and restaurant owners, hoteliers, transport providers, entertainment and nightlife and other regional tourist attractions.  

From February to May 2021 Wolverhampton will be hosting ‘British Art Show 9’, the most anticipated exhibition of cutting-edge contemporary art in Britain. The Show will bring thousands of art-lovers to Wolverhampton from across the UK and beyond, putting our cultural offer firmly in the spotlight. British Art Show 8 attracted over 300,000 visitors in its tour to four cities from October 2015 to January 2017, providing valuable footfall and visitor spend to the tourism, hospitality, retail and entertainment businesses. The organisers for the Wolverhampton aspect to the show will outline how you can prepare and benefit from this fantastic opportunity and help to put Wolverhampton on the cultural map.

Speaker: 

Maggie Ayliffe, Head of Wolverhampton School of Art

Marguerite Nugent is Manager, Arts and Culture, City of Wolverhampton Council

name: Developing High Performance Teams ONLINE
html_description:
How much is employee disengagement costing your business?  Learn the facts and figures and work out how much of your payroll is dead money.  You don’t know what you don’t know.  You cannot train engagement so please come and learn new things... We can teach you to make every employee a profit centre for your business. Your employees won’t change if you don’t take action and lead the way.  Often as a company grows, the direct line of sight to the original mission and culture has become foggy or even lost. With a lack of clear direction along with a set of guiding core values, larger companies become havens to those with a mentality of "ME" rather than "WE".  As business leaders it’s critical to re-engage the team to give them back their purpose and make some discoveries on the way. With a re-energised and re-engaged workforce, the company will be a high performing fun place to work which will attract the people and the customers that you want. It's never too late to challenge the culture that exists and start creating a new one if the old one isn't serving you or your company well.  

If you are the Business Owner, CEO or MD of a business with 20 to 200 employees you can attend this online workshop and find out how to create transformational change in 3 months or less.  Lots of real life examples, amazing results, case studies and testimonials.  

Learn about the current engagement stats in the UK and what you can do about it. You will learn some simple methods to light a fire within your organisation, reconnect with the core values of why the business exists and how to push that message from top to bottom and see a real difference in the company’s performance quickly. All attendees will have an opportunity to get a Free Employee Engagement Survey to measure Engagement in their organisation.  

Speakers: 

Karrie-Ann Fox, Engage & Grow Master Coach

NLP Practitioner

DISC Practitioner
