html_description: A session facilitated by Higgs & Sons’ HR and employment team. The event is aimed at anyone who runs or operates a business and employs staff or has responsibility for HR in the workplace. HR Directors, managers etc.

name: Effective Leadership: Enhancing productivity and growth ONLINE
html_description:
Recent studies suggest that ineffective management costs the UK over £19 billion per year in lost working hours. Good leadership is essential to successfully manage an efficient and productive workplace. This in-depth event will introduce the new Acas framework for effective leadership and demonstrate how it can be applied in practice. It will consider the business advantages of good leadership and provide delegates with the opportunity to identify and build on their own leadership styles. 

The event is aimed at delegates from all sectors of industry including: managers, supervisors, team leaders, HR professionals, business owners, Trade Union representatives, employee representatives and individuals who wish to enhance their CPD.  

Delegates attending this event will discover their own leadership style, gain an understanding of the new Acas framework for effective leadership and have the opportunity to put theory into practice.

name: Supporting staff mental wellbeing across the Black Country ONLINE
html_description:
Black Country Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust.  Supporting staff mental wellbeing across the Black Country.  The event is aimed at businesses of any size across the Black Country, Directors, Heads of Service, Line Manager, Business Owners, HR staff, Employees.  It’s everybody’s business to know about mental health and well being.  Attendees will gain knowledge, challenging stigma, confidence in supporting others with mental health difficulties and seeking support for self, developing support networks, sharing and highlighting good practice in business.

Theme: Managing Mental Wellbeing at work during a pandemic

Case Study examples

name: Tour of Lonsdales - Business Storage Facilities & Recycling for Manufacturers
html_description:
We know that Brexit, and more recently the effect of Coronavirus, is of a concern to many manufacturers and how these events may impact businesses. Businesses may be looking to stockpile materials in the event that there may be problems with supply or shortages, but this leaves businesses with the issue of where to keep stocks and how to easily access them without affecting the day to day running of the business. Likewise there may be delays with dispatching manufactured goods to certain areas and again storing these goods post manufacture may have an impact on the day to day running of the business with demands on space. Businesses also have slow moving stock such as warranty parts or tools that are currently out of production that need to be kept, but again can take up considerable space. Not all businesses will have considered external storage and there is a perception that it is an expensive and long term solution only available to larger companies with a lot to store. We would like to show the advantages of using external storage and how storage can be flexible to meet and suit the needs of businesses.  

We are aiming our event at local manufacturers. We understand the issues experienced by manufacturing businesses in terms of finding space to store materials to support production and the limitations placed on production due to capacity for storing finished goods. We don't have minimum storage quantities or time period, so we are flexible to meet our customers requirements. We want businesses to understand the benefits of using external storage.

The metals side of our business provides a metal collection service, and other forms of waste, providing skips, bins etc and offering a total waste management and recycling service.  

We hope to make attendees aware of the benefits of using external storage to support their business requirements, especially businesses that haven't considered external storage before. We want to demonstrate how flexible and convenient our service can be and how using our service could help their business.  

Agenda: 

10:00am - Arrival

10:00-10:15am - Networking 

10:15 am - Introduction to Lonsdales & tour of the facilities -  Green Lane site & Fryers Road site (The two sites are a short car journey apart - we will encourage questions as we tour the facilities)

11:15am - End of tour, ending comments

11:30am - Depart Lonsdales. 

Members of the team will be in attendance and lead the warehouse tour.

name: BCBF Golf Day
html_description:
BCBF Golf Day – Golf event consisting of up to 20 teams of 4 players (Gents and Ladies)

Tee-times available from 11.00hrs until 14.00hrs at 10 min. intervals. 2 from 4 Stableford Competition off Yellow Tees – 90% H’cap allowance.

Bacon bap with Tea/Coffee upon arrival. Prize presentation by Steve Bull MBE. at approx. 18.30hrs.

Proceeds from the day will go towards the Captain’s Charities, which are Prostrate Cancer UK and Marie Curie.

We have hosted the event for the last 2 years and both events proved to be a great success raising hundreds of pounds for charity and emphasising the importance of Golf and Business links.

The event is open to all local businesses in The Black Country.  Businesses will become aware that Golf Clubs can provide solutions to meeting spaces, catering, company activity and even large scale corporate events.  Golf can also provide excellent opportunities for networking along with the obvious health benefits, both physical and mental.  By attending on the day it can open the lines of communication, provide an opportunity to meet great people and network with like-minded professionals, as well as raise money for good causes.  Understand how Golf can be incorporated into your business for the benefit of your employees, clients and your organisation.  

Cost for a team of 4 is £100, which includes a £5 donation per person (i.e.£20 per team) towards the aforementioned Captain’s Charities.

Please register your place here and contact the Club on 01902 341142 to complete the application form and to make payment.

name: Third Week Wednesday - Business Festival Special ONLINE
html_description:
In This Year’s Black Country Business Festival  - TWW – Third Week Wednesday Goes Hybrid…..

Our regular Third Week Wednesday hits this year’s Black Country Business Festival as a hybrid event on 14th October.

Running digitally via Zoom, and FREE to attend, the event will give dozens of businesses the chance to connect and offers delegates the opportunity to use their own social media channels to reach out and share their business message.

Headed up by Chamber membership adviser, Richard Brooks, the live streaming business event offers interviews, in between the open networking sessions, and a chance to project your business message out to the many thousands who follow via the Chamber’s social media platforms.

This event is aimed at business owners, directors, partnerships, sole traders for advice on various legal issues and people will have the opportunity to ask questions from at least six lawyers who specialise in different areas of the law.  We will raise awareness of potential issues that can cause disruption to your business and offer solutions.

name: How to safely and fairly recruit young people with convictions - ONLINE
html_description:
Black Country Talent Match are an intensive mentoring service supporting young adults with an offending background to move closer to work. Partnering with the Black Country Chamber of Commerce, we are hosting a session for businesses to find out everything they need to know about how to safely and fairly recruit someone with an offending background. This workshop will be lead by Dominic Headley. Dominic, formerly of NACRO, is a specialist consultant in criminal record policy and safer recruitment.  

This event is aimed at businesses of all sizes and anyone with input into staff recruitment.

Attendees will gain confidence and knowledge relating to safely and fairly recruiting people with offending backgrounds and can receive support from Black Country Talent Match to do so. 

By the end of this session you will:

* Understand and apply the relevant legislation that impacts upon recruitment and retention of people with criminal records (e.g. ROA 1974, DPA 1998/ GDPR 2018).

* Learn how to deal effectively with disclosure of criminal records.

* Gather the relevant information in order to inform the risk assessment process.

* Understand how to interpret criminal record information in order to inform risk assessment processes.

* Understand how to risk assess applicants/employees with criminal records in the context of safe recruitment and reputational business risk.  

• Understand how to recruit confidently and effectively from the talent pool of over 11 million people in the UK with convictions

• Be able to improve the diversity of your workforce

• Understand how to minimise any potential or perceived risks that might be involved

• Learn how to avoid unnecessary failed recruitment costs.  

Agenda:

02.30pm -  Break for 20 mins

02:20pm - Part 2  and Q & A session 

04.00pm - Close 

Speaker: 

Dominic Headley FRSA

name: Turning The Black Country Green - Session 2 ONLINE
html_description:
Turning The Black Country Green - Taking the region through it's second industrial revolution. Attendees will learn how they can transform their business, become Carbon Neutral certified to PAS2060 and increase their profits. Businesses can gain the competitive advantage by differentiating themselves from their competition by demonstrating their commitment to the environment by reducing Carbon, whilst significantly benefiting their bottom line.  Reduce energy costs by up to 40% & energy consumption by up to 20%, begin to measure, reduce and report their Carbon Footprint on their journey to become Carbon Zero ahead of the UK backstop of 2050.

Carbon Zero Energy, Decentralised Energy, Energy Optimisation, Carbon Measuring & Reporting, Carbon Offsetting.  

The event is aimed at Financial Directors, Managing Directors, Operation Directors/Managers, Facility Managers of businesses of all sizes and from all industries. It specifically benefits medium to large manufacturers that consume large amounts of energy and produce large amounts of carbon.  

Attendees will be learn how they can measure, reduce, report their carbon footprint on their journey to becoming Carbon Neutral certified to PAS2060. We will demonstrated how decentralised energy can reduce costs by up to 40% and the integration of our energy management systems can reduce consumption by up to 20%. Attendees can integrate a bespoke Carbon dashboard that will measure and report their journey of becoming Zero Carbon. We provide bespoke holistic solutions that can be provided with zero CAPEX requirement and assists businesses in future proofing their business.

AGENDA - 14th October

1.30pm - 2.00pm – 2050 Net Zero & Carbon Neutral WHAT, WHY, WHEN & HOW

2.00pm – 2.30 pm – Decentralisation, Optimisation, Decarbonisation 

2.30pm – 2.50pm – PAS2060 Carbon Neutral, Carbon Offsetting, UK School Tree planting program.

name: Queen’s Award for Enterprise – Create a Winning Entry! ONLINE
html_description:
Entering awards could be invaluable for you and your business and there is nothing more prestigious than winning a Queens Award for Enterprise. During this interactive session you will hear from previous winners and Deputy Lieutenants who will explain the benefits associated with winning an award, as well as the reality of the process itself. You will then enjoy a digital workshop designed to help you significantly improve your chances of creating a winning entry! 

A popular misconception is that the awards are always won by large organisations. This is not the case as you will hear from our region’s previous winners.

The Queen’s Awards for Enterprise are awarded to businesses which excel in International Trade, Innovation, Sustainable Development and Promoting Opportunity.

Irrelevant of your size or sector, if you are proud of what your company achieves and feel like you have a story to tell, then you should attend this online event.  

What will attendees gain?

Many leaders don’t understand the benefits these awards can bring to the business and therefore don’t pursue them. However, previous winners have broken into new markets, attracted investment, raised morale and improved their chances of attracting the best talent in the region.

This event is designed to inspire you to do the same for your business and to provide the tools to help you create the best entry possible. 

Agenda:

Welcome from the Lord Lieutenants office

Introduction from a Deputy Lieutenant

Panel Session with previous winners

Digital Workshop

name: The Business of Winning
html_description:
Meet the University of Wolverhampton Racing (UWR) Team, the only student run team in the UK who race in the F3 Cup and the Morgan Challenge, and take a close look at our professional calibre racing cars. The highly commercial nature of motorsport, linked with its popularity and high profile, lends itself well to the development of business partnerships. It allows a raft of commercial entitlements that offer genuine potential as a dynamic, innovative business-development platform.nIn addition to meeting the team, this event will share with you the stories of several UWR sponsors who have utilised the tailored opportunities and range of commercial entitlements that are on offer to meet their individual business development requirements.nBy attending the Business of Winning, you will discover exciting dimensions to add to your existing business development strategies, from meeting and hosting clients, to growing your social media content. 

This event is aimed at anyone, in any scale of business, with a passion for, or an interest in, motorsport. It will likely be particularly pertinent to MD’s, marketing/ PR staff, or business development staff.

Attendees will gain an insight into the workings of a student-run professional motorsport team and the multiple competitions they take part in. The presentations will focus on harnessing the unique opportunities that working with a motorsport team give to businesses on any scale, and hearing from current UWR sponsors on the innovative use of their bespoke relationship to develop new business opportunities, and maintain a strong dynamic with existing contacts.

html_description:
Leaders from the Chamber, CBI, Make UK, IOD and FSB discuss what businesses need to do to survive and grow in an economy impacted by Brexit, the Recession and Covid 19.

Adam Marshall, Chief Executive - British Chambers

Mike Cherry, Chair - FSB

name: Brownfield: Money Generator or Money Pit? ONLINE
html_description:
Own or occupy a brownfield site or thinking about buying such a site or renting premises on one? Not sure about the advantages and disadvantages? Want to know more about what might be involved in developing brownfield land or the latest techniques available to support your development? BRIC (Brownfield Research & Innovation Centre) can answer all these questions.  The event is aimed at SMEs that are involved in the remediation and redevelopment of brownfield sites, this could include remediation companies, land developers, land owners, construction companies, house builders, architects.

The event will offer:

• Practical advice - Specialist presentations delivered by members of the BRIC team providing insight into strategies, innovations and techniques used to tackle the challenges posed by brownfield sites.

• Case studies – providing hands-on experience of the free support offered by BRIC to Black Country SMEs.

• Networking - Meet with other businesses involved in brownfield remediation and redevelopment. Whether you want to have a 1-2-1 with a member of the BRIC team, raise your profile, or simply catch up with peers, this BRIC event offers a great networking and knowledge sharing opportunity.

Attendees will gain practical advice from Brownfield experts, see live case studies and network with professionals involved in redevelopment projects.  

Agenda / Speakers:

Mark Schneider, BRIC Project Manager: Project Overview

Noukhez Ahmed, BRIC Researcher: The BRIC Index

Rana Khan, BRIC Researcher: Practical demonstration of the BRIC Equipment

Tony West, BRIC Knowledge Transfer Manager: A BRIC case study

Jan Bayley, BRIC Knowledge Transfer Manager:  A BRIC case study

name: Changes to Legal Education and Routes to Qualification ONLINE
html_description:
Changes to Legal Education and Routes to Qualification: Implications for private practice and how the University can support. Over the last 5 years there have been significant changes in legal education which impact on professional practice for both private law firms and larger organisations who employ legal teams.  The event is aimed at private law firms and larger organisations that employ legal teams are invited to a special event hosted by Professor Sukhninder Panesar, Head of Law at the University of Wolverhampton.  

Delegates will hear more about changes to legal education, the new models of professional qualifications, degree apprenticeships and part time studies available for staff at all levels, and the ways businesses need to position themselves and their staff.  

The session will include a presentation and an opportunity to discuss the support that the University can provide locally.  

Speaker: Sukhninder Panesar – Head of the Wolverhampton Law School

name: Working towards a healthier workforce ONLINE
html_description:
An employee wellbeing strategy is not just an added extra, today it is a must for any business wanting to increase productivity, promote healthier lives and reduce sickness/absence. The University of Wolverhampton Faculty of Education is uniquely placed to offer a joined-up approach to promoting the health and well-being of your workforce. This event will showcase how the University’s dedicated offering of sports science, personal training, health and fitness facilities combined with the use of a fully registered bone densitometry and body fat composition scanner, can be used to measure and enhance your workforce’s health and wellbeing.

We can offer:

• Initial screening questionnaire to ensure they meet with DXA referral criteria for body composition

• First body composition scan with results consultation straight after scan

• Result shared (with consent) with dedicated fitness instructors and recommendations for areas for improvement based on the scan results for example: reduction in visceral fat levels, to reduce risk of obesity related conditions or in case of muscle presenting greater in one side of the body more than the other, that muscle is built up equally to prevent injury or risk of balance impairment.

• Dedicated fitness instructors who will contact the employee and arrange a one to one planning session based on patient feedback and scan results.

• Employee will have use of the sports centre (gym, exercise classes and swimming pool) for a period of 12 weeks to complete their exercise plan

• Post 12 week scan, this is compared to initial scan. All results discussed with the employee following the scan and changes made during that period

• The employee is offered a discounted corporate membership at the gym following completion of the 12 weeks wellbeing package.

This interactive workshop will explore employee health and wellbeing and propose a tailored structure to engage employees with a health improvement programme.  

The event is aimed at any organisation’s development, human resources or management teams with an interest in promoting health and wellbeing in their organisations.  Attendees will gain an  overview of health and wellbeing strategies for employee engagement and further knowledge of a tailored programme offered by the University of Wolverhampton to promote employee health and wellbeing.

name: Tackling diversity on Trustee boards ONLINE
html_description:
There are over 1 million trustees in the UK supporting 196,000 charities, but what makes a good trustee and how can charities ensure that the diverse communities they serve are represented in the make-up of their own trustees? Managers of charities and third sector organisations; existing charity trustees; those who might be considering the role of a charity trustee, and those involved in recruiting charity trustees at either Board level, senior management or otherwise. The event will be facilitated by members of Higgs & Sons’ Charity and Not for Profit team who will use their vast experience of all aspects of charity law to focus on the particular considerations of organisations when recruiting and retaining trustees. 

This keynote seminar will explore the role and responsibilities of charity trustees, and what charities can do to encourage those from under-represented community groups to consider becoming a trustee.  

Speaker: 

Kirsty McEwen, Head of Charity and Not for Profit, Higgs & Sons

name: The Future of Construction is Digital ONLINE
html_description:
In our most ambitious collaboration yet we are bringing together leading experts in construction and digital technologies from the University of Cambridge and the University of Wolverhampton to help Black Country SMEs in the construction sector to improve their operations.

The Institute for Manufacturing at the University of Cambridge will reveal how simple, low cost and off the shelf digital technologies can be combined to provide practical digital solutions to specific industry challenges, giving examples of successful pilot solutions developed for manufacturing businesses.

The Construction Futures Research Centre at the University of Wolverhampton has been set up to support SMEs achieve high standards of delivery in offsite construction. We will demonstrate how using technology and Modern Methods of Construction is the solution to the housing crisis.  

The event is aimed at MD / Manufacturing Director / Operations Manager from SMEs involved in construction and manufacturers supplying the construction sector.  

What will attendees gain? 

• Introduction to Modern Methods of Construction and how this can speed up and improve the efficiency of house building
• How Black Country SMEs can get fully funded support to achieve high standards of delivery in offsite construction
• Build awareness of low cost digital solutions for manufacturing
• Reflect on business priorities
• Identify potential digital solutions to help address these priorities
• Outline a priority digital solution for your individual business

Agenda / Schedule:

11:05 – Digital Construction on a Shoestring Workshop, facilitated by the University of Cambridge

  • Shoestring overview and demonstrator videos

  • Outlining priority digital solutions

name: Invest in your greatest asset - Your staff
html_description:
Richard Branson famously said - "Train people well enough so they can leave, treat them well enough so they don't want to". This interactive and informative workshop delves into the importance of investing in your staff, nurturing talent and encouraging progression within your organisation.  Information is also available on the funding available and practical advice on how to apply for and secure funding. The event is aimed at SMEs. Attendees will gain an understanding on why employee development is vital to your business.  Learn of the funding available to SMEs.

Attendees will come away with an understanding on why it is important to invest in your staff, tools and techniques on how to improve employee engagement and information to take away with them on where they can get additional support. 

Areas to address:

Your lovely Staff - Asset or cost?
Being good at your job - What does productivity really mean today?
Role and expertise - When does an employee have enough training?
Progression and value - Are you just training them to leave?

Speaker: 

Mike Ryan, Tutor, Gecko Programmes

name: Show me the money ONLINE
html_description:
This seminar will look at payment on construction projects. Experts from Higgs’ Construction and Engineering team will explore what options are available to contractors and sub-contractors when they are faced with payment issues. The issues discussed will be applicable to construction projects of all sizes and will be useful to construction industry professionals, contractors and developers. The seminar will offer tangible practical advice on the position under construction contracts and how to get paid and limit losses in construction projects and will also refer to payment issues arising as a result of COVID 19.

Speakers:

Rachael Hobbis

Adam Thompson

name: The National Foundry Training Centre Open Evening
html_description:
Join Elite Centre for Manufacturing Skills for a tour of the UK’s only foundry training centre right here in the Black Country.  The event is aimed at manufacturing and engineering businesses with an interest in the foundry and metalforming industries.  ECMS will be showcasing the capabilities of the National Foundry Training Centre including cutting edge casting technologies, Sand Lab and Pattern Workshop. The facilities will also be available for research techniques and commercial usage.  Delegates will see the unique facilities now available through ECMS for specialist foundry training, commercial hire and research.

Agenda: 

5:30pm - Snacks and Networking
5:50pm - Welcome and Introduction by ECMS
6:05pm - CMF Chairman Stuart Gregory - Introduction to Cast Metals Federation
6:15pm - Tour Begins - Foundry and Pattern shop , IT Suite and Sand/Metal Lab
7:00pm - Q&A Session
